WRITING.TITLE: Looking for a good tabletop vaporizer. #128077;
WRITING.TEXT: Long story short, I recently lost my beloved table top vaporizer. It was a hose type with a built in fan (noble vapor). All I can find are these passive air type vaporizers and they give me the worst head pressure because I having to suck really hard (that's what she said!). I've tried pen type vaporizers and have the same issue. I'm trying to find another table top hose type with a built in fan. It seems if I can't find what I am looking for I may end up going with a volcano. Please give me any suggestions if you know of any forced air vapes or if you have your own suggestions. I would appreciate it! Happy vaping! :)

So I know this sounds crazy but I actually had a realization maybe a few years back. This would happen to me all the time where I would be feeling great and then the next day I would just feel super awful and I would feel like crap the next few days. Sometimes I would even feel depressed, suicidal, or even just plain I don #8217;t give a fuck about anything in my life. I would have what you would probably call outbursts and just really depressive episodes. Then I started cutting out food in my diet and I noticed that whenever I would eat wheat ( Anything bread related or anything that contained gluten ) the next day and days afterwards I would feel this way. Doing some research led me to find out that some peoples bodies have a sensitivity to the ergot In the gluten. So pretty much anything that contained ergot would cause this to happen. I would suggest trying to cut these things out of your diet and going so far as to be very cautious what type of foods you put in your body. Barley and wheat are two main offenders when it comes to this type of thing. You may notice that you feel better cutting these out.

So to answer your questions as best I can - Expected amount of sessions: expected amount of sessions depends on skin, age of tattoo, and the artists hand (heavy handed vs. Light handed). Some people can see complete fading in 3-4 sessions and some won #8217;t see any major difference until 6-7. In my personal experience I didn #8217;t see anything crazy until after 4 sessions. - Pian: that depends on your tolerance and also tattoo location. They do offer things to help ease pain during the removal like numbing cream, zimmer (it #8217;s like a refrigerated ac hose you direct at tattoo site), and some places offer nitrous oxide or aka laughing gas. My experience with pain is mixed. I recently had a full calf tattoo laser and it was really rough for me but it was very large and the ink was super dark. - Severity of scarring or likelihood: again this depends on your body. Some people end up with major scarring and some don #8217;t. You will already have scarring from the tattoo itself because a tattoo is basically a scar. Do be aware that you may have hypopigmentation in the area of the tattoo. - Cost per session: this depends on the clinic. Some places give a good deal and some don #8217;t. You are looking at about 100-400, but since your tattoo is small it will probably be on the lesser side. Clinics do offer discounts for multiple pieces done or multiple sessions paid up front. - Risks: typical risks are that of potential infection if the wound is not properly cared for. Your clinic will give you aftercare instructions which you need to follow diligently to ensure good results. Advice: go with a good laser. Picosure or Cutera Enlighten. Those are the best on the market as I know of right now and will give you better results in sooner time. Just expect your poor guy to be quite sore and probably no sex for up to two weeks. Best of luck!
Don #8217;t I fucking wish.

WRITING.TITLE: Pico sure VS cutera
WRITING.TEXT: Hi all. So I have previously had experience getting a tattoo removed with the Picosure laser. Seven sessions in the tattoo is maybe 80% removed. I recently started getting another tattoo removed with the Cutera and I #8217;m just curious if anybody has had any good luck with the Cutera or if the Picosure would be a better idea. Is one better with colored inks and another is better with black ink #8217;s?

Honestly I noticed more fading as time went on. I had gotten a tattoo lasered and ended up not going back for a whole year and I noticed more feeding during that time than I did in between the six weeks that the technician had said. This time I #8217;m going 12 to 14 and I #8217;m pretty sure I #8217;m going to see better results
Thank you!
I appreciate it. Thank you for replying

Same here buuuuut I actually found this awesome cream online (can I link it to you here without getting in trouble?). I put it on 2-3+ hours before my session, wrapped with plastic wrap and kept it on til the appointment. Then an the appointment they cleaned off my cream and put their own on for another 30 minutes. I can not tell you how much anxiety I had before the session but once the laser hit I literally FELT NOTHING. Of course I am getting 2 lasered at a time but the cream really changed the experience. The cream didn #8217;t wear off until the next day but your experience might be different. Also took extra strength Tylenol and I think that helped too.
That was me at day 2 haha

WRITING.TITLE: Finally broke my plateau. Yay for small victories!
WRITING.TEXT: Back story. Had a baby in December and postpartum weight was 184. Got down to 165-167 and had been struggling to break that. Finally after a week of OMAD and my first attempts at extended fasting (24-48hrs) my weight this morning was 156.5 and that is plus 38 oz of water in my system. My next goal is 145. To anyone struggling right now, you CAN do it and you will!
